'''''Fuddo and Slam''''' is a Text-Adventure video game designed by [[John Wilson]]<ref>[http://ifdb.tads.org/viewgame?history&id=i9m9j3bo50ku56o5 The Interactive Fiction Database] (retrieved 3 December 2010)</ref> and [[Shaun G. McClure]].<ref name="Spectrum">[http://www.worldofspectrum.org/infoseek.cgi Fuddo and Slam] at [[Wikipedia:World of Spectrum|World of Spectrum]] (retrieved 3 December 2010)</ref> The game is a parody based on ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''<ref name="Tolkien Games">[http://www.lysator.liu.se/tolkien-games/entry/fuddo.html Tolkien Games] (retrieved 3 December 2010)</ref> and is a sequel to ''[[An Everyday Tale of a Seeker of Gold]]'' and forms a part of ''[[The Balrogian Trilogy]]''.<ref name="Tolkien Games" /><ref name="Spectrum" />

== Story ==
After ''Bulbo'' gambled his ring away, his friends ''Fuddo'' and ''Slam'' embark on a quest to retrieve the ring.<ref name="Tolkien Games" />
